title: In Harry Potter and the Sorcerer’s Stone, when Harry bought “the lot” off the candy trolley, did he buy the entire stock, or just one of everything? - Quora
tags: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (2001 movie)
Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone (book)
Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (book)

response.answer_text: Harry only says “We’ll take the lot” in the movie. In the book, he is just overwhelmed by all the new wizard snacks he’s never seen before and “Not wanting to miss anything, he got some of everything”. We know he got more than one of everything because he ends up with a pile of chocolate frogs and has plenty of everything else to share with Ron. But even in the movie, I think we’re meant to understand that he only takes a bit of everything and doesn’t empty the cart. The cart is meant to feed the entire train, Harry and Ron couldn’t possibly eat that much. As a complete side note, how adorable is the line, “‘Go on, have a pasty,’ said Harry, who had never had anything to share before or, indeed, anyone to share it with. It was a nice feeling, sitting there with Ron, eating their way through all Harry's pasties, cakes, and candies (the sandwiches lay forgotten).” Harry is such a sweet child.
